com.math.combinations

Class SigmaAlgebra

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra

  • public class SigmaAlgebra
extends Object
    Generates all possibilities of elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SigmaAlgebra

        public SigmaAlgebra(int v,
            int t)
        Constructor taking parameters for computing all the possibilities.

        v_power_t is always ready once the object is created using this constructor however the value if too large will always be erroneus

        Parameters:
        the - total number of values an event can take
        the - number of events that will occur

      • SigmaAlgebra

        public SigmaAlgebra()
        Default constructor takes no parameters. Note that set methods must be used before operating on the methods of this class
        See Also:
        com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setV(), com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setT()

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        This method indicates if the all the possibilites have finished generating.

        A reset is required to start again else subsequent calls will always return the last possibility.

        Returns:
        If the permutation is still not complete

      • next

        public int[] next()
        This method returns the current possibility and shifts to the next one.
        Returns:
        The current possibility

      • done

        private boolean done()
        Method to test if we are at the last possibility.

        The last possibility of any v^t is given by n-1,n-1,n-1, .... k times.

        Returns:
        true if the last possibility is reached

      • update

        public void update()
        Computes the updated value of v_power_t.

        This method should be used if v_power_t is required after calls to @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setV() or @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setT()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets the program to its initial state {0,0,0 .... k-1 times}. After this method the possibilities can be generated again by calls to
        See Also:
        next()

      • setV

        public void setV(int v)
        This method sets the total number of values each element can take.

        Note: This does not update v_power_t. That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#update() Also, to prevent inaccurate states it is advised to call @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#reset() See also @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#getN()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of values

      • setT

        public void setT(int t)
        This method sets the total number of events that the elements occur in.

        Note: This does not update v_power_t. That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#update()

        Caution: An update to k brings the program back to its initial state at 0,0,0....k with all previous progress lost.

        See also @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#getV()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of events that the elements may appear together in

      • getTotal

        public long getTotal()
        This method is used to return the value of v^t for the current object.
        Returns:
        the value of v_power_t for the current object

      • getV

        public int getV()
        This method returns the total number of values that the elements of this object can take. See also @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setV()
        Returns:
        The number of values that the elements may take

      • getT

        public int getT()
        This method returns the total number of events that the elements take part in See also @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra#setT()
        Returns:
        The number of events that the elements participate in
